metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7599 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 10.2 is affected. Safari before 10.0.2 is affected. iCloud before 6.1 is affected. iTunes before 12.5.4 is affected. The issue involves the "WebKit" component. It allows remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy and obtain sensitive information via a crafted web site that uses HTTP redirects.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7599` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.14.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.14.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.14.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.14.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.14.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.14.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
webkit2gtk package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.14.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
